RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: has MSc(2004) and BSc(2002) degrees in Computer Science. He obtained the PhD in 2008 by the Institute of Mathematical and Computing Sciences at The University of Sao Paulo (ICMC-USP), Brazil, which was partially developed at the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering of Imperial College London. His interest areas are hardware architecture, embedded mobile robotics, and modeling and synthesis tools. He has also several years of industrial experience in automation systems. He is a faculty member of the ICMC-USP since 2009.

Inicialmente, esses dados serгo enviados a um Desktop para o teste e a validaзгo de algoritmos com a ferramenta Matlab. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Proposta de um framework para o desenvolvimento de sistemas embarcados para a robуtica mуvel
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto de pesquisa propхe o desenvolvimento de um framework para a modelagem, simulaзгo e sнntese de sistemas embarcados para a robуtica mуvel. O framework permitirб que sistemas compostos por blocos de hardware e software sejam modelados num ambiente de programaзгo visual/grбfico utilizando-se a linguagem de meta-modelagem MARTE. A partir desse modelo, o usuбrio poderб gerar componentes de hardware em Bluespec e ainda realizar a simulaзгo do modelo de modo integrado com um ambiente de robфs mуveis, podendo o robф ser real ou simulado. O framework tambйm permitirб a realizaзгo de profiling do software e a geraзгo de hardware para a sнntese em circuitos integrados do tipo FPGA (Field-Programmable Gate array). Assim, este trabalho tem como propуsito acelerar o processo de construзгo e validaзгo de arquiteturas de hardware e software e incentivar o ensino e a pesquisa nas бreas de sistemas embarcados e robуtica mуvel, estando tudo isso apoiado em metodologias recentes de meta-modelagem e de desenvolvimento em ESL (Electronic System Level).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This research project proposes a framework development for modeling, simulation and synthesis of embedded systems for mobile robots. This framework will allow systems composed by hardware and software modules to be modeled in a graphical environment based on MARTE profile. Given a model, the user will be able to simulate the whole model integrated with real or simulated mobile robots and also to generate hardware components from Bluespec language. The framework will allow the user to profile the software and to synthesize the hardware components to FPGA (Field-Programmable Gate array). Therefore, this work aims to accelerate the hardware and software architecture co-design via meta-modeling and ESL (Electronic System Level) development and to help the research and teaching process about embedded systems and mobile robotics.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O consumo de energia й uma das questхes mais importantes em sistemas embarcados. Estudos demonstram que neste tipo de sistema a cache й responsбvel por consumir a maior parte da energia fornecida ao processador. Na maioria dos processadores embarcados, os parвmetros de configuraзгo da cache sгo fixos e nгo permitem mudanзas apуs sua fabricaзгo/sнntese. Entretanto, este nгo й o cenбrio ideal, pois a configuraзгo da cache pode nгo ser adequada para uma determinada aplicaзгo, tendo como consequкncia menor desempenho na execuзгo e consumo excessivo de energia. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Centro de Pesquisa, Inovaзгo e Difusгo do Centro de Ciкncias Matemбticas Aplicadas а Indъstria (CEPID-CeMEAI)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This proposal focuses on promoting the use of mathematical sciences and in particular applied mathematics, statistics and computer science as an industrial resource. We plan to do this within an interdisciplinary setting, emphasizing technology transfer and education and knowledge dissemination for industry and government applications, organized by an especially tailored structured research Center: the Center for Mathematical Sciences Applied to Industry CEPID-CeMEAI, whose nucleus already exists at USP. The Center?s main strategy is to build a strong infrastructure with regard to human resources, advanced computational equipment, collaboration opportunities and other facilities in order to promote interdisciplinary cooperation with industry and, more specifically, with the manufacturing, government and service sectors. The Center will encourage academic research groups to collaborate on effective applications and produce new scientific knowledge. The core groups in the Center have demonstrated experience in producing academic work of high quality in their areas of activity and, in many cases, also in relevant applications, evidence of which will be provided in the Technology Transfer section of this project. The core groups and their collaborators will continue with their usual scientific activities, enhanced by the interaction opportunities created by the Center, and at the same time, develop an underpinning role that mathematics plays across with all industries.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Evaluation of aspect-oriented compilation and synthensis for heterogeneous FPGA-based high-performance computing
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
High-Performance Computing (HPC) is at the core of many scientific and engineering challenges and is making a tremendous impact on modern-day life. Technological improvements and increased clock rates have meant that today?s modern computers have impressive sustained concurrent computations with aggregate Peta-flop calculations rates. Despite this, the rate of improvement has reached a plateau due to energy and resilience issues. The base cores of these machines exhibit fairly low computational efficiencies and further performance and energy gains are slim at best. The move to highly concurrent machines increases not only the energy requirements for these large-scale machines but also exacerbate the difficulty in effectively programing them. As a result both performance and programs are highly non-portable.
An architectural approach that addresses these concerns of power efficiency and high-performance capabilities relies on the use of Field-Programmable Gate-Arrays (FPGAs) as hardware accelerator units. In this architectural organization the FPGAs act as co-processors or as traditional processor units and carry out specific computations for which they can be custom-programmed to be extremely powerful and computing efficient. In terms of the overall system-level programming this ?master-slave? model is very intuitive to grasp and can be easily implemented as part of the back-end of a traditional compiler. The compiler simply generates code that copies data (using the appropriate communication library) to the FPGA co-processor sub- system (or hardware board via a PCI Express interface as it is common in today?s FPGA-based hardware accelerator devices) and awaits the completion of the task(s) on the remote FPGA device. While the computation proceeds on the FPGA, the host processor is free to pursue its own computing goals by delaying until as late as possible the synchronization with the FPGA slave co-processor [Din05, So02, Nob10].
The proposed project aims at developing, implementing and evaluating a novel compilation and synthesis system approach for FPGA-based platforms geared towards the exploration of the vast design spaces that are derived from the use of a wide range of high-level code and mapping transformations. The approach uses genetic algorithm techniques and user-defined performance metrics (in the form of aspects) to indicate, for selected section of an application, what are the relevant optimization criteria [Gol89]. As the mapping of an individual hardware design can take hours to complete, due to the lengthy Place-and-Routing phases of logical and physical synthesis, we rely on fast hardware resources and performance estimation techniques [Kul02]. The compilation and synthesis flow uses the ?real? data derived for a sample set of hardware designs (after the lengthy mapping steps) to calibrate the estimation engines and the genetic algorithms in an ?off-line? training phase. Then on an ?on-line? phase it uses these estimates and transformations models to quickly derive high- quality hardware designs for computations with characteristics that are similar to those of the designs used to calibrate the internal models.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Evaluation of aspect-oriented compilation and synthensis for heterogeneous FPGA-based high-performance computing

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto visa mitigar o risco de migraзгo de cуdigos da arquitetura tradicional para sistemas heterogкneos, atravйs de interfaces de alto nнvel para desenvolvimento de cуdigo, sem comprometer a aplicaзгo, aproveitando ferramentas jб existentes no 'back-end' da geraзгo de cуdigo e ferramentas de exploraзгo de projeto para a sнntese de hardware e compilaзгo, minimizando a dependкncia de risco e de tecnologia. A abordagem baseada em camadas de software proteje o investimento em duas direзхes: do desenvolvimento da aplicaзгo (portabilidade da aplicaзгo) e dos programadores (portabilidade de programador). Serб demonstrado o uso e benefнcio de uma DSL (Domain-Specific Language) - a linguagem LARA - e sistemas de geraзгo de cуdigo correspondente, usando aplicaзхes de missхes crнticas das instituiзхes participantes (previsгo de tempo, sistemas de navegaзгo autфnoma e mecвnica de fluнdo computacional).
